gr.fire.browser
Class Browser

java.lang.Object
  gr.fire.browser.Browser
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResponseHandler, PageListener, javax.microedition.lcdui.CommandListener
public class Browser
extends java.lang.Object
implements CommandListener, PageListener, ResponseHandler

The Browser parses XHTML from a given stream and renders it. It has some basic rendering rules that are choosen to improve the readability and usability of a page when rendered for a small screen.
* The default width of the browser is the width of the screen.
* TextPrimitive width is set as the width of the Browser unless noted otherwise by the style of the tag.
* TextPrimitive height is the height of the text calculated using the width (according to the rules above) and the font of the text.
* ImagePrimitive width is the width of the image unless noted otherwise by the style of the tag.

Author:
padeler

Field Detail

NO_IMAGES

public static final byte NO_IMAGES
Flag for the imageLoadingPolicy field. No images are loaded.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOAD_IMAGES

public static final byte LOAD_IMAGES
Flag for the imageLoadingPolicy field. Load images imediatelly

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOAD_IMAGES_ASYNC

public static final byte LOAD_IMAGES_ASYNC
Flag for the imageLoadingPolicy field. This is the default browser behaivior. Load images in a seperate thread after the full parsing of the page. The browser will return the Page object and start a thread to load the rest of the images. This will apply only for images that the width and height attributes are set. Images that do not have their width and height attributes set, will be loaded imediatelly.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

loadPage

public Page loadPage(java.lang.String url,
                     java.lang.String method,
                     java.util.Hashtable requestParameters,
                     byte[] data)
              throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                     java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.Exception
Loads the page from the given URL using the supplied method and request parameters and data. This method will use the supplied HttpClient httpClient to make the request and then render the page.
The resulting will be added to added to a Page instance and returned to the caller. It will not handle "meta" tag information, but will return them inside the Page instance.

Parameters:
url -
method - The method can be HttpConnection.GET or HttpConnection.POST
requestParameters - params for the http request header
data - if the method is HttpConnection.POST the post data if any must be in this byte array
Returns:
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.Exception

loadPageAsync

public void loadPageAsync(java.lang.String url,
                          java.lang.String method,
                          java.util.Hashtable requestParameters,
                          byte[] data)
This is the asynchronous version of the loadPageloadPage(String, String, Hashtable, byte[]) method. It will start a new thread to handle the request and it will send the result Page to the registered PageListener instead of returning it to the caller.

getViewportWidth

public int getViewportWidth()
The Browser renders each page based on a set width and unbounded height. The viewportWidth is the width of a rendered page. If the page contains elements that do not fit in the viewpoerWidth It will increase the width of the resulting page ignoring the viewportWidth.

Returns:

getImageLoadingPolicy

public byte getImageLoadingPolicy()
There are different policies on loading the images of a Page.
- Browser.NO_IMAGES
- Browser.LOAD_IMAGES
- Browser.LOAD_IMAGES_ASYNC (default)
The load LOAD_IMAGES_ASYNC will skip images with preset width and height (as img tag properties) and will try to load them after the Page is done loading. This greatly speeds up Page loading.

Returns:

setImageLoadingPolicy

public void setImageLoadingPolicy(byte imageLoadingPolicy)
Parameters:
imageLoadingPolicy -
See Also:
getImageLoadingPolicy()

pageLoadFailed

public void pageLoadFailed(java.lang.String url,
                           java.lang.String method,
                           java.util.Hashtable requestParams,
                           java.lang.Throwable error)
Description copied from interface: PageListener
Only called when pageLoadAsync is used to load a page. The loadPageAsync failed with an exception. A callback to the PageListener is made with the error.

Specified by:
pageLoadFailed in interface PageListener

isShowLoadingGauge

public boolean isShowLoadingGauge()

setShowLoadingGauge

public void setShowLoadingGauge(boolean showLoadingGauge)

cancel

public void cancel()
If there is a rendering process on this Browser instance this method will cancel it. This method will not close any connections or interrupt i/o operations. It will only prevent the data from beeing rendered. If images are beeing loaded asynchronously a call to this method will also stop the image loading thread.

stopRendering

public void stopRendering()

pageLoadProgress

public void pageLoadProgress(java.lang.String url,
                             java.lang.String message,
                             byte state,
                             int percent)
The default implamentation of this method.

Specified by:
pageLoadProgress in interface PageListener
Parameters:
url - The requested URL.
message - A short message. Can be the url or a default status message
state - A value describing the current status of the process. The listener will receive atleast one method call with state PAGE_LOAD_START and one with PAGE_LOAD_END (PageListener.PAGE_LOAD_START, 112).
percent - The percentage of the page loaded. This is just an estimated value.
See Also:
PageListener#pageLoadProgress(String, byte, int)
